data.title: Washington 211
data.meta_description: Before you search for services, view these helpful tips.
data.text:
211 helps connect you to community resources statewide.

Looking for help?

Dial the number 211 or use the following link to search now.

Before you search for services, view these helpful tips.

Community Needs Data

Access an online dashboard of live 211 caller data to research community needs anywhere in the State of Washington.

Tramatic Brain Injury (TBI)

Let us help: learn more about TBI and find resources that can help.

Watch:

Information and Referral - Help is Just a Contact Away

Dial 2-1-1, anytime, for assistance.

211 connects callers, at no cost, to critical health and human services in their community.

If you are unable to find a service, please dial 211 for assistance. If you are outside of Washington State or having a problem using the 211 number, please call 1-877-211-9274.

Helping Washington connect to services.

Washington 211 provides the most current and comprehensive database of community resources in the State of Washington (over 30,000 listings), which serves as a central access point for connecting Washington residents to community resources. By simply dialing the number 211, searching the website, or texting 211WAOD to 898211, people can connect to help when they need it regardless of who provides the services or where the services are located.

A trusted resource for Providers.

Whether your organization is a recognized health and human services provider or is a small community based organization providing basic assistance, 211 can help connect people in need to your services or assist you in referring clients to additional community services.. Use the following links to add or update resources for your community

List your Resource

Connect to the Community

Update a Resource

Keep information up-to-date
